triplets: Portable source of light made from wax and a wick, often used for illumination, decoration, or ceremonial purposes
Providing light, decoration, aromatherapy, religious and ceremonial purposes, ambiance creation
Wax (paraffin, beeswax, soy, or palm), cotton or synthetic wick, sometimes added dyes or fragrances
Wax body that melts to sustain the flame
Wick that carries fuel to the flame
Varies widely: white, red, blue, yellow, green, and multicolored
Home decor, ceremonial items, emergency lighting kits, and aromatherapy products
Various manufacturers including artisanal candle makers and industrial producers
Typically 5–30 cm depending on type and purpose
50–500 grams depending on size and wax density
Burn time typically 2–10 hours depending on size, wax type, and wick
